name: Black-Eyed Pea Sausage Dip
author: hstar07
summary: If you do not really care for black-eyed peas but want to bring good luck for the New Year, try this recipe. Put this in the slow cooker the night before and have an amazing dip the next evening! Serve this at a party as a dip or serve with cornbread for a meal. Very versatile recipe. Serve hot with tortilla chips or crackers.
ingredients: salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 (12 ounce) package reduced fat pork sausage
2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as Rotel®)
directions: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add onion and celery; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes
Scoop vegetables into a slow cooker
Place sausage in the same skillet
Cook, breaking apart with a wooden spoon, until browned, 5 to 6 minutes
Transfer to the slow cooker; pour in black-eyed peas and diced tomatoes with green chiles
Cook on Low until black-eyed peas are tender, about 16 hours
